name: Ghanaian Jollof Rice
instructions: 1. Blend tomatoes, peppers, and onions. 2. Fry the paste + seasonings in oil. 3. Add washed rice + stock; simmer until done. 4. Stir occasionally to prevent burning.

name: Fried Spaghetti with Veggies
instructions: 1. Cook spaghetti until al dente. 2. Stir-fry onions and vegetables in oil. 3. Add cooked spaghetti and tomato paste; mix well.

name: Fried Rice
instructions: 1. Cook rice until tender. 2. Stir-fry vegetables and onions in oil. 3. Add cooked rice, soy sauce, and beaten eggs; stir until eggs are cooked.

name: Creamy Avocado Salad
instructions: 1. Dice avocados, tomatoes, cucumber, and onion. 2. In a bowl, mix lemon juice, olive oil, salt, and pepper. 3. Toss the vegetables in the dressing until well coated.

name: Spring Rolls
instructions: 1. Soak rice paper in warm water until soft. 2. Place shrimp/chicken, lettuce, carrots, cucumber, and mint on the wrapper. 3. Roll tightly and serve with peanut sauce.

name: Fufu with Light Soup
instructions: 1. Boil cassava and plantain until soft. 2. Pound together until smooth and stretchy. 3. Serve with light soup made from blended tomatoes, peppers, and your choice of fish or meat.

name: Banku with Grilled Tilapia
instructions: 1. Mix fermented corn dough with water and cook until smooth. 2. Grill tilapia and serve with pepper sauce. 3. Enjoy banku with grilled tilapia and sauce.

name: Kenkey with Pepper Sauce
instructions: 1. Prepare fermented corn dough and wrap in leaves. 2. Boil until firm. 3. Serve with pepper sauce and optional fish or meat.

name: Ghanaian Fried Yam
instructions: 1. Peel and cut yam into thick slices. 2. Heat oil in a pan and fry yam until golden brown. 3. Drain on paper towels and sprinkle with salt.

name: Hausakoko
instructions: 1. Roast corn until golden brown. 2. Mix with groundnuts and sugar if desired. 3. Serve as a snack.

name: Waakye
instructions: 1. Cook rice and beans together with waakye leaves for color. 2. Prepare stew with tomatoes, peppers, and your choice of meat or fish. 3. Serve waakye with stew and fried plantain if desired.

name: Grilled Tilapia with Spicy Sauce
instructions: 1. Marinate tilapia with lemon juice, salt, and oil. 2. Grill until cooked through. 3. Serve with spicy pepper sauce.

name: Banku with Okra Stew
instructions: 1. Prepare banku by mixing fermented corn dough with water and cooking until smooth. 2. For the stew, cook okra with tomatoes, onions, and pepper; add fish or meat if desired. 3. Serve banku with okra stew on the side.

name: Beans Stew
instructions: 1. Cook beans until tender. 2. In a separate pot, fry onions and tomatoes with spices. 3. Add cooked beans to the stew and simmer for 20 minutes.

name: Kontomire Stew
instructions: 1. Wash and chop kontomire leaves. 2. In a pot, heat palm oil and fry onions, tomatoes, and pepper. 3. Add kontomire leaves and cook until tender; add fish or meat if desired.

name: Palm Nut Soup
instructions: 1. Boil palm nuts until soft, then blend to extract the oil. 2. In a pot, cook meat with onions and spices. 3. Add blended palm nut oil and simmer until thickened.

name: Rice and Egg Stew
instructions: 1. Cook rice until tender. 2. In a pan, fry onions and tomatoes with spices. 3. Add beaten eggs and stir until cooked; serve over rice.

name: Rice and Kontomire Stew
instructions: 1. Cook rice until tender. 2. In a pot, heat palm oil and fry onions, tomatoes, and pepper. 3. Add chopped kontomire leaves and cook until tender; serve over rice.

name: Ghanaian Sandwich
instructions: 1. Boil eggs and slice them. 2. Toast bread slices. 3. Layer eggs, tomatoes, onions, and lettuce on one slice; spread mayonnaise on another. 4. Combine slices and cut in half.

name: Stir-Fried Spaghetti
instructions: 1. Cook spaghetti until al dente. 2. In a pan, heat oil and stir-fry garlic, ginger, and vegetables. 3. Add cooked spaghetti and soy sauce; stir until well combined.

name: Tomato Stew
instructions: 1. Blend tomatoes, onions, and pepper. 2. In a pot, heat oil and fry the blended mixture until thickened. 3. Season with salt and spices; serve with rice or bread.

name: Vegetable and Fruit Salad
instructions: 1. Chop all vegetables and fruits into bite-sized pieces. 2. In a bowl, mix lemon juice, olive oil, salt, and pepper. 3. Toss the salad with the dressing until well coated.

name: Yam and Stew
instructions: 1. Peel and cut yam into chunks; boil until tender. 2. In a pot, heat oil and fry onions, tomatoes, and pepper until thickened. 3. Serve yam with the stew on top.
